sen.j: 祇園（ぎおん）とは京都の代表的な繁華街及び歓楽街。
sen.e: Gion is one of the most popular downtown areas and entertainment spots in Kyoto.

sen.j: 本来は祇園の「祇」の字は「示」+「氏」と書く（祗園は誤記。wikt祇を参照）。
sen.e: Originally, the kanji character '祇' (gi) as in '祇園' (Gion) was formed by combining '示' (ji) and '氏' (shi); however, '祗園' (Gion) today is a misspelling (see wikt, or Wiktionary: '祇').

sen.j: 八坂神社（江戸時代までは祇園社）の門前町として鴨川_(淀川水系)から東大路通・八坂神社までの四条通沿いに発展した。
sen.e: Gion developed as a monzen-machi (a town established around a prominent temple or shrine) of the Yasaka-jinja Shrine (called Gion-sha Shrine until the end of the Edo period) along Shijo-dori Street from the Kamo-gawa River to the shrine on Shijo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 原文には、「鴨川_(淀川水系)」 とありますが、「_(淀川水系)」はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「鴨川_」だけとなっており、本来はこちらの用語だけを使用していると思われますので、こちらだけを訳出しました。

sen.j: 京都有数の花街（舞妓がいることでも有名）であり、南座という歌舞伎劇場もある。
sen.e: Gion is one of the major hanamachi ('flower town,' or geisha district also famous for apprentice geisha) in Kyoto, and has a kabuki theater called Minamiza.

sen.j: 現在は茶屋、料亭のほかにバーも多く、昔のおもかげは薄らいだが、格子戸の続く家並みには往時の風雅と格調がしのばれる。
sen.e: Gion today has many bars in addition to chaya (teahouses) and ryotei (traditional Japanese restaurants), and thus traditional townscape has been disappearing; the streets lined with houses with lattice doors, however, remind one of the elegance and dignity of the past.

sen.j: 北部の新橋通から白川沿いの地区は国の重要伝統的建造物群保存地区に選定、南部の花見小路を挟む一帯は京都市の歴史的景観保全修景地区に指定され、伝統ある町並みの保護と活用が進んでいる。
sen.e: The area along the Shirakawa River to the north of Shinbashi-dori Street in the north of Gion has been selected as one of the Important Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings while the area around Hanamikoji-dori Street has been designated as the Historical Landscape Preservation and Improvement District: the preservation and use of traditional townscape have been enhanced.
